Here are some ideas for ways to select your number:
* Day of the month, or the ones digit of the day of the month
* Day of the school year
* Randomly â€“ Roll a die, pull a slip of numbered paper from a jar, pull a card from a deck.

For very young students, start out by using quantities of objects. 

if the quantity is 5, show 5 things. How can we make 5 things? 
* Have 2 things and then 3 more.
* Two rows of two and one more.
* Have 7 things and take 2 things away.

Here are some restrictions to focus the ideas your students come up with on skills you might want to be practicing.
* The answer must use one more or one less, two more or two less
* They must reference a number path, number line, 100 chart, calendar
* One of the numbers must be __.
* Have at least 3 numbers being added
* Allow just addition or just subtraction
* They must use both addition and subtraction
* Write the number in different forms - numerals, words, expanded form
* Only use odd numbers or even numbers
* They must use ten frames or bundles of ten for place value practice
* Have students construct a number line with the number somewhere on it
